meanings.definition: Regard as probable; expect or predict.
meanings.sent1: I am anticipating a sunny day tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She is anticipating a fun weekend ahead.
meanings.sent3: The cat is anticipating a mouse to chase around.
meanings.sent4: The students are anticipating the upcoming exam like a looming storm.
meanings.sent5: He was anticipating the arrival of his long-lost friend with great excitement.

meanings.definition: Look forward to; foresee or predict.
meanings.sent1: They are anticipating a delicious meal at the new restaurant.
meanings.sent2: We are anticipating a successful outcome for the project.
meanings.sent3: The dog is anticipating a walk in the park with wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The flowers blooming in spring are like nature anticipating the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent5: She was anticipating the moment she would finally meet her favorite singer.

meanings.definition: Act as a forerunner or precursor of.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds are anticipating the arrival of a storm.
meanings.sent2: The first snowflakes are anticipating the start of winter.
meanings.sent3: The early morning chirping of birds is like nature anticipating the dawn.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of thunder is anticipating the approaching rain.
meanings.sent5: The rustling leaves are anticipating the arrival of autumn.
